gnu.statistics
Interface ProbabilityDistribution

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContinuousDistribution, DiscreteDistribution
public interface ProbabilityDistribution

This interface gives the requirements for a statistical distribution.

Method Summary
 int getMaxIterations()
          Return the maximum number of iterations to expect for convergence for any operation on this distribution.
 Monotonicity getMonotonicity()
          Used to determine convergence of a series.
 double getPrecision()
          Get the precision for doing calculations with this distribution.
 boolean isContinuous()
          Return true if a continuous distribution.
 boolean isDiscrete()
          Return true if a discrete distribution.
 void setPrecision(double p)
          Set the precision for doing calculations with this distribution.
 

Method Detail

isDiscrete

public boolean isDiscrete()
Return true if a discrete distribution.

Returns:
boolean True if discrete.

isContinuous

public boolean isContinuous()
Return true if a continuous distribution.

Returns:
boolean True if discrete.

setPrecision

public void setPrecision(double p)
Set the precision for doing calculations with this distribution.

Parameters:
p - The precision.

getPrecision

public double getPrecision()
Get the precision for doing calculations with this distribution.

Returns:
double The precision for calculations.

getMonotonicity

public Monotonicity getMonotonicity()
Used to determine convergence of a series. Return an object that describes the monotonicity of the distribution.

Returns:
Monotonicity The monotonicity of the distribution.

getMaxIterations

public int getMaxIterations()
Return the maximum number of iterations to expect for convergence for any operation on this distribution.
